intro: Chromolaena rigida, commonly known as ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped, rough to the touch, and often have a silvery or grayish underside. Chromolaena rigida produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
